name: Mount Your Friends
description: Experience the extreme simulated sporting sensation that's sweeping our digital nation! Mount Your Friends is a fiercely competitive sporting event for you to play with your friends in the contextual security of your own home, assuming that your home is not composed of sexual innuendo.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Later Processor: 2.4 GHz or better Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Graphics card capable of Pixel and Vertex Shader 3.0 (game uses XNA 4.0 in Hi-Def mode) DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 200 MB available space Additional Notes: Currently requires Windows Media Player to be installed on your system. Game supports Microsoft XBox 360 Controllers or Keyboard/Mouse control

I'm going to tell you a story.  It was a late college night, and my friends and I were bored and had nothing to do. However, one of my friends just got some dollar from doing sick GFX and wanted to buy a game.  At first, he wanted Lego ♥♥♥♥ing Batman (Yes, I know) but he remembered this amazing game, this pinnacle of game design. So, he bought 4 copies of this game (1 for myself, himself, and two other friends), and we began to play.  I downloaded and launched the game, and imediatly I was engulfed in lovely fapping sounds. I fell in love. We began to play, I could feel the inner mount coming out from deep inside of me. It was a good feeling.  I love this game, it truely is amazing. Thank you creator, thank you so so much.

There isn't much to Mount your Friends. It's a quirky competitive game where you use physics and sticky hands and feet to climb and fling yourself to the top of the tower made up of all the other players. Every player mounting the tower makes it taller until eventually someone wins. It's really simple, well polished, but really fun to play with friends.  Solo content is available but it's not too interesting and without enemy AI, it's mostly challenges such as climb one of several given obstacle courses. Multiplayer is the preferred choice if you can grab some friends to play with. You'll be hard pressed at times to find anyone else hosting a public game. Customization is also an option, you can use some of the preset stuff to customize your team or import your own images for the body and head. This is a really cool feature that me and my friends have been abusing to import ridiculous looking characters into our game. The downside is they don't work in multiplayer, only you can see them unless you share the exact same picture with everyone else you're playing with. I'm hoping the devs patch something in to fix this but until then, the best solution is packing everything all your friends are using into a zip file on dropbox and just pass it around to all your friends.  Multiplayer has 2 Gameplay modes and 2 Variable Weather Effects that change the gameplay. Vertical climb is a simple climb to the top of the growing tower of friends. Horizontal is the same but the tower must extend to the right of the screen instead of the top. These two games modes are accompanied by Space and Storm weather effects which change the physics somewhat to challenge you. Space gives you low gravity, which makes jumping and flinging yourself around easier, but also more dangerous. Flinging yourself too far on Horizontal can lead to falling into the pit below and instantly losing, while in Vertical, you can accidentally fling yourself off the tower which spells doom for most situation. Storm halts your progress by always pushing you to the left in a windy storm. This makes it hard for everyone to move or climb and flinging yourself is a lot harder.  Overall it's quick and easy fun, you can kill time playing it or have a game night with friends, flinging off of Bill Nye in a Bra to achieve your victory. While the Single player content is lacklustre, Multiplayer is fun and worth the money if you have friends to play it with.   At £4 it's an easy purchase, unless you really need that £3.99 Whopper Meal.  You fat monster

Has banana hammock physics. Look at the pictures on the store page, now imagine those gentlemens' packages swinging independently as they climb up towers of other gentlemen and try not to laugh. If that doesn't make you laugh, you probably don't enjoy fun. And if it does, buy this game.  It's a fantastic addition to a same-screen competitive game collection and a definite winner at game nights. I wouldn't bother if you only like solo games, but playing this against someone else is guaranteed to generate some laughs.  One thing I didn't realize when I bought the game is that there are multiple game modes, and some of them are a ton of fun too. Another point for Mount Your Friends.

Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox. Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly. He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together. His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron. He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him. Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play. He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens. The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about. Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth. He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.

Mount Your Friends has gone to great lengths to reinvigorate Mount Your Friends. From the unsettling vision of powerful mercenaries run amok in 2054 America, to the cybernetically enhanced abilities, to the touch of a whole new lead development team at Sledgehammer Games, this iteration is the biggest and most successful departure from what's expected from a Mount Your Friends game since Mount Your Friendsbrought the series into the 21st century. Mount Your Friends definitely hasn’t discarded the excellent, fast-paced run-and-gun shooting that made Mount Your Friends a household name; instead, it’s taken that strength and committed itself completely to the idea that mobility and flexibility are king, making it faster and more focused than any Mount Your Friends game before it.

I will admit that upon first seeing the trailer for this game, I thought it was just another of a long and ever growing line of stupid games that people purchase and support simply because it allows them to write some funny one-line review on Steam.    I received this game as a gift and I did not want to even install it. However, this would have made me an a**hole for not accepting my friends gift. Three of us played together for a few hours the first night, and I will say that I was laughing so hard at certain points that tears were pouring out of my eyes and it became difficult for me to focus on the screen. And the laughter is not just from the swinging ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. In fact, the ♥♥♥♥♥ is forgotten about pretty quickly. What is amazing about this game is, seeing someone smoothly walk up to the goat for the first time. Or when you see someone perfom a quadruple flip from the bottom of the pile to the top and grab the piles peak in a smooth, swift, and sexy motion.  In a game where everything is filled with such frustrating and awkward movements, seeing someone accomplish something that appears to be a well timed and coordinated move is simply amazing. It is awe inspiring. And it motivates me to want to be better at it. I want to learn how to walk. That sounds so crazy to say, but in all seriousness, the ability to walk fluidly from your spawn to the goats rear end is a skill possessed by gods.  As difficult as a simple task such as walking may be, the controls are intuitive and allows a person to start playing immediately (side note: I am playing this on a X360 controller and imagine a keyboard would be more difficult.)  I definitely encourage every one to buy and play this with friends. It is a great time. I have since purchased 2 gifts for other friends, and I will probably buy more.

Mount Your Friends is basically competitive GIRP, with spinning dongles (or zippers, if you play in SFW mode) and the slightly unnerving wet slapping sound of flesh on flesh. With a variety of game modes and a very reasonable price tag, Mount Your Friends is the kind of silly fun that gamers these days often look for, and with online multiplayer that actually functions it's a must buy if you have other silly people to play it with.  I give Mount Your Friends a 69/69.
Its really funny, buy it!

Finally: a party game that isn't local co-op only. Granted, the online multiplayer offerings are limited to the vertical tower or horizontal bridge modes (with an option to turn on wind that continuously blows you away), but they are hilariously stupid enough to guarantee that you and up to 3 other friends will be able to spend hours mounting each other from the relative safety of your own homes. The local co-op and single player modes are terrific as well. If you have $5 in your wallet and people on your friends list, this is an absolute no-brainer.
Amazing game to play with friends for a good laugh.
Ist sexy too say the least

For all of the laughs my friends and I have gotten out of this game so far, it's definitely worth the $5 dollar purchase. The object of the game is to climb a tower of your friends as you all stack onto a goat. There are various multiplayer maps as well as several singleplayer modes. You can customize your team as well as import custom bodies and skins you have made. I played this game when it launched for the Xbox 360 and was not disappointed when I found it on Steam just a few days ago.  Also, you can play with more than just 2 people in a lobby. With multiplayer you can have 2-4 players in your lobby/game.

Im gonna post a semi serious review, if you read negative reviews, its because they are people taking this game way to seriously. This game revolves around nonsensical climbing combined with spinning dongs. If you try to take this game seriously, you're not gonna have a good time.  Now so i still have a funny-ish review, in my first match against my friend i did nothing but teabag his characters with my spinning dong. I won.  10/10

My first experience with this game was via the xbox indie arcade. I first laughed off this NSFW title, but once it came out on PC i instantly felt the charm. The quick play and multiplayer are great with friends and the music and sound effect add the the sense and thrill of getting to the top of the tower of swinging meat men. Controls are all up to you. I had some issues with the team builder not working correctly but for under 5$ this is great game.
